intro: Lisianthius collinus, commonly known as the mountain lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
